question.title: Get all child jar artifacts of pom submodule as dependency in module
question.body:
So I have the following structure:

project_root
|   pom.xml
|   
+---services_pom
|   |   pom.xml
|   |   
|   +---service1_jar
|   |   |   pom.xml
|   |
|   +---service2_jar
|   |   |   pom.xml
|   |
|   |     .
|   |     .
|   |     .
|   |   
|   \---serviceX_jar
|       |   pom.xml
|
\---main_jar
    |   pom.xml

"services_pom" is a pom project with submodules which childs implement a certain interface which is loaded in the module "main_jar" with ServiceLoader.load(ServiceInterface.class);.

At this moment, I have to declare all services as dependency in the pom.xml of "main_jar" that "maven-dependency-plugin" can copy them into a lib folder and the "maven-jar-plugin" can correctly setup the classpath in the jar's manifest file.

Is there a way to tell maven "get all child modules of services_pom and put the jars into a lib folder and setup the class-path entry in the manifest file in main_jar?
I tried

<dependency>
   <groupId>${project.groupId}</groupId>
   <artifactId>services_pom</artifactId>
   <version>${project.version}</version>
   <!-- Tried with and without this type element... -->
   <type>pom</type>
</dependency>

without success ...

This would be more elegant than setup all "serviceX_jar" artifacts as dependency in "main_jar"'s pom.xml.

Goal would be to have this structure:

main_jar
|   pom.xml
|   
+---target
|   |   main_jar.jar
|   |   
|   +---lib
|   |   |   service1.jar
|   |   |   service2.jar
|   |   |       .
|   |   |       .
|   |   |       .
|   |   |   serviceX.jar

And in the manifestfile in "main_jar.jar" there is the line:
Class-Path: lib/service1.jar lib/service2.jar lib/serviceX.jar

question_comments.body: Create a separate module, define the dependencies to other jar's and use maven-assembly-plugin to create the lib directory...
